intro: Anemone fragifera, commonly known as the fragrant anemone, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice among gardeners seeking colorful, low-maintenance plants.
